{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which hormone(s) are under inhibitory control of the hypothalamus, we need to look for information about inhibitory hormones released by the hypothalamus. Document [19] mentions that the hypothalamus uses somatostatin to inhibit the actions of Growth Hormone-Releasing Hormone (GHRH), which controls the release of Growth Hormone (GH). Document [28] also states that somatostatin is released from the hypothalamus into the blood and travels to the anterior pituitary. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Both prolactin and growth hormone.", "answer_choice": "D"}
